page.title: 11QUESTIONNAIRE SURVEY
page.content: Large proportions of our sample felt that Bar Hill needs more shops,more sporting facilities and generally more for people,especially teenagers,to do.We also found that, because of its design,95% of those questioned consider the village to be a very safe place,especially for children.Some of these people are a little worried though that the village is too safe.Children have little or no fear of traffic and have not had to develop or learn good road sense. Only 32% of our sample actually work in the village and the vast majority of these are working mums.Those that travel out of the village to work go mainly to Cambridge,Huntingdon or St.Ives, although there is a minority travelling long distances,even as far as London.
